#317 0' 10.6"
110.23 lbs. 		Sea Glass Pokémon Glastle are obsessed with their shiny glass shell. They protect its integrity at all costs and spend hours each day cleaning it to maintain its sheen.

Ability Learnset

By leveling up

Level Ability Score Description
1 Weak Armor 4 Physical attacks to the Pokémon lower its Defense stat but sharply raise its Speed stat.
18 Screen Cleaner 4 Entering a battle nullifies the effects of Light Screen, Reflect, and Aurora Veil.
36 Clear Body 5 Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.
54 Refraction 7 Boosts the power of Beam-type moves.
72 Prism Armor 7 Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.
90 Mirror Armor 9 Bounces back only the stat-lowering effects that the Pokémon receives.
100 Magic Guard 12 The Pokémon only takes damage from attacks.
  • Bold indicates a default ability if multiple abilities are disabled
  • Italic indicates hidden ability if multiple abilities are disabled

By Disc

Disc Ability Score Description
Disc 05 Immunity 4 The immune system of the Pokémon prevents it from getting poisoned.
Disc 20 Sand Force 7 Boosts the power of Rock-, Ground-, and Steel-type moves in a sandstorm.
Disc 53 Arena Lock 9 Negates statuses that affect the whole field.
Disc 55 Regenerator 8 Restores a little HP when withdrawn from battle.
Disc 58 Prism Armor 7 Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.
  • Bold indicates a default ability if multiple abilities are disabled
  • Italic indicates hidden ability if multiple abilities are disabled

By tutoring

Ability Score Description
Adaptability 8 Powers up moves of the same type as the Pokémon.
Arena Trap 10 Prevents opposing Pokémon from fleeing.
Arid Armor 6 Boosts the Pokémon's Defensive stats on Arid Terrain.
Clear Body 5 Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.
Dazzling 6 Surprises the opposing Pokémon, making it unable to attack using priority moves.
Distillize 8 Normal-type moves become Water-type moves. Their power is boosted a little.
Dry Skin 6 Rain and Water-type moves restore HP. Sunlight and Fire-type damage hurt more.
Emergency Exit 4 The Pokémon, sensing danger, switches out when its HP becomes half or less.
Gunk Guard 6 Boosts the Pokémon's Defensive stats on Noxious Terrain.
High Entropy 5 Boosts the Pokémon's Evasiveness under Gravity.
Inflexible -3 This Pokémon can only use the first move it uses in battle.
Magic Guard 12 The Pokémon only takes damage from attacks.
Marvel Scale 5 The Pokémon's marvelous scales boost the Defense stat if it has a status condition.
Mirror Armor 9 Bounces back only the stat-lowering effects that the Pokémon receives.
Mud Armor 6 Boosts the Pokémon's Defensive stats on Muddy Terrain.
Natural Cure 7 All status conditions heal when the Pokémon switches out.
No Guard 8 The Pokémon employs no-guard tactics to ensure incoming and outgoing attacks always land.
Predictable -4 This Pokémon's predictable maneuvers make moves hit against it without fail.
Protean 8 Changes the Pokémon's type to the type of the move it's about to use.
Protosynthesis 3 Boosts the Pokémon's most proficient stat in harsh sunlight or solar wind.
Rain Dish 3 The Pokémon gradually regains HP in rain.
Refraction 7 Boosts the power of Beam-type moves.
Sand Veil 3 Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in a sandstorm.
Screen Cleaner 4 Entering a battle nullifies the effects of Light Screen, Reflect, and Aurora Veil.
Serene Grace 9 Boosts the likelihood of additional effects occurring when attacking.
Simple 8 The stat changes the Pokémon receives are doubled.
Slow Start -5 For five turns, the Pokémon's Attack and Speed stats are halved.
Tinted Lens 7 The Pokémon can use “not very effective” moves to deal regular damage.
Truant -5 The Pokémon can't use a move if it had used a move on the previous turn.
Weak Armor 4 Physical attacks to the Pokémon lower its Defense stat but sharply raise its Speed stat.
Weak Bones -4 Halves the Pokémon's Defense stat.
Wonder Guard 18 Its mysterious power only lets supereffective moves hit the Pokémon.
Flood Surge 9 Turns the ground into Flooded Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.
Solar Power 4 Boosts the Sp. Atk stat in harsh sunlight or solar wind, but HP decreases every turn.
  • Bold indicates a default ability if multiple abilities are disabled
  • Italic indicates hidden ability if multiple abilities are disabled
